function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Lack of statistically significant relationship between natural environment and prevalence of obesity","Impact":"Inability to confirm the impact of natural environment on obesity prevalence could lead to ineffective urban planning and public health interventions.","Mitigation":"Conduct further research with a larger and more diverse sample to determine the true relationship between natural environment and obesity prevalence.","Technologies":"Data analysis tools and statistical software for processing and analyzing large datasets.","People":"Public health professionals, urban planners, and policy makers.","Owner":"Research institutions and government agencies."},{"Description":"Correlation between Black population and higher prevalence of obesity in a non-linear fashion","Impact":"Risk of neglecting specific health interventions and support for communities with higher Black population, leading to health disparities.","Mitigation":"Implement targeted health programs and policies to address the unique needs of communities with a higher Black population.","Technologies":"Community health assessment tools and targeted health intervention programs.","People":"Community health organizations, local government, and healthcare providers.","Owner":"Public health organizations and local government."},{"Description":"Heterogeneity in the associations of low-income and high education with prevalence of obesity","Impact":"Failure to address the complex relationships between socioeconomic factors and obesity prevalence, leading to ineffective interventions and programs.","Mitigation":"Customize interventions to address the unique needs of different socioeconomic groups and consider contextual factors in program design.","Technologies":"Data analysis tools for identifying subgroup variations and community engagement platforms for tailored interventions.","People":"Public health practitioners, community leaders, and social service organizations.","Owner":"Public health agencies and community organizations."}]}
